website_summaries.verdict: Though not as intuitive as higher-priced models, it's worth considering if you are looking for a budget-priced DVR.
pros: Has lots of capabilities considering the budget-friendly price, including HDMI connectivity, easy recording, and versatility
cons: It's a bit confusing to set up and instructions are lacking, but customer service is attentive
Internal hard drive is a separate purchase

customer_reviews.text: This product is truly WONDERFUL, I am a tech GURU and LOVE all new and exciting items, this is truly a WONDERFUL piece of engineering. customer_reviews.author: Jan Harde

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Recorder!
customer_reviews.text: After reading all the reviews on this and other recorders, I purchased this one. This baby works like a charm. I purchased a 2TB internal and a 2TB external drive. It's a simple operation to transfer from the internal to the external drive and from there to my desktop computer (it has two 3TB drives). It is not required, but I always make backup copies of everything. Once you get used to the 24 hour time format it's a breeze to use.
customer_reviews.author: Jack the paintball man

customer_reviews.title: This recorder works perfectly so far.  Just what I need and just what I wanted!
customer_reviews.text: This recorder works perfectly so far. It is small and does exactly what I wanted it to do. I have been looking for something like this for a while. If you need to capture an HDMI stream to a flash drive or external hard drive this is one of the best units out there at this price I think. I love the remote, it makes the whole process very easy and quick. Love it! Thank you and good job. :)
customer_reviews.author: Mike Talon

customer_reviews.title: For my needs, the AverMedia is excellent
customer_reviews.text: If you are comfortable doing basic assembly tasks -- and following instructions -- this HDMI recorder is a perfect solution. Picture and sound are excellent. Be prepared for large file sizes: 1 hour at the best HD setting (1080p/60) takes up about 6-7 GB. If you wish to rename files, you'll need to remove the hard drive and attach it to your PC: The AverMedia itself names the files according to date/time of the recording.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen M. Lewis

customer_reviews.title: Used a lot works good.
customer_reviews.text: Used a lot works good. Playback has no way of say going to the middle of the recording other than fast forward Least I haven't found a way yet might be a way I bought a second 1I like it enough I've had these for over 2 years and have not had a breakdown I don't understand the reviews that I am seeing now I plan on buying another one for my daughter at Christmas
customer_reviews.author: Mark V.

customer_reviews.title: Recording Stopped - Poor Writing Performance
customer_reviews.text: This product does not work for me recording HDMI from my computer or from a video camera I use in surgery. It records for about 2-3 minutes and then crashes with an error message 'poor writing performance'. "recording stopped". It stopped working less than 3 months after I bought it. I have tried it with several different thumb drives. I looked at the website and it looks like there is no way to return it and there is no customer support that I could find.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Cohen

customer_reviews.title: Great quality recording, clunky interface, worth a full FOUR ★'s!
customer_reviews.text: Does exactly what is says - the interface is sort of clunky, and slow. But considering that it does what not many other devices can do, I am pleased with it's performance. I can tell that the recordings are recordings, but JUST barely. It records very good quality. I love that the very first item in the top of the box upon opening it was a piece of paper WARNING you not to bypass the copy protection with a splitter. I am so relieved that they are doing so much to combat piracy! Fantastic!
customer_reviews.author: C.Q. Young

customer_reviews.title: It works but I have serious concerns.
customer_reviews.text: This may appear as a second review. I discovered that I can't edit a review in Amazon review and I had more information. There is something wrong with this unit. After I wrote the review I decided to unplug and disconnect until I had some time to come up with a cooling pad. Even the cable connection was so hot it was uncomfortable to unscrew. There is no way that this box should generate so much heat that everything connected to it is uncomfortably hot to the touch. I will contact the manufacturer and will report back on their response.
customer_reviews.author: artie

customer_reviews.title: I doesn't work for satellital television
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product and a splitter because I wanted to record my favorite TV shows that broadcast on my satellite television company. Although I followed all the instructions step by step they didn't work due to the HDCP. (I wanted to record my favorite shows to have at home, not for piracy). So, if you have the same idea of ​​trying to record your favorite TV shows from any satellite television (DirecTV, Sky, or any other company), don't waste your money on this product.
customer_reviews.author: R. Peralta

customer_reviews.title: Good HDMI input recorder
customer_reviews.text: Just about every video device I own is an HDMI output. But you can only record those images in low res composite video format (That's the yellow/red/white cable) because of MPAA influence on Congress. This little box solves that problem. It records in full 1080 HD. The replays are great. It will not remove HDCP copy protection. No problem (do your homework). The only complaint is the inability to easily rename the files. Also file sizes are large. For a 2 hr event 8Gb to 12Gb. I use a partitioned 4 Tb drive
customer_reviews.author: SeekerGeorge

customer_reviews.title: Good for very SHORT clips, but useless for long recordings
customer_reviews.text: Even best quality, high speed flash drives require constant formatting, otherwise there are always error messages saying that the memory device is unable to handle speeds involved with recording bitrates. The longest recording time I’ve ever achieved is approx 8 mins. After that recording stops and I get error messages saying to either format flash drive or adjust quality of video cause it can’t keep up! Very irritating.
customer_reviews.author: DW

customer_reviews.title: It's okay for "basic" record and playback of a single item.
customer_reviews.text: It's okay. Slow response time. Clunky Interface. Doesn't remember last location in a played video. Crowded remote. Press the record button and walk away - it will record whatever you have it hooked up to for hours/days (depending on drive size). Playback is fine, but FF/Rew controls are just so-so.
customer_reviews.author: J. Dobber

customer_reviews.title: Great standalone pvr/dvr.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent HD standalone capture device (without PC). Works well. Only flaw/bug is TV screen goes blanks briefly (2 seconds) when you record/pause/stop with remote, for the OSD display option. The same issue happened on the older C283 model, but was fixed with a firmware update. I have used the older pvr for 3-4 years with no problems. So I believe the Avermedia products are reliable.
customer_reviews.author: Chaz

customer_reviews.title: No customer support what so ever.
customer_reviews.text: I had this for about a year and it worked great, but after that it didn't work at all. I tried all the fixes, like new HD and formatting and such to no luck. But the biggest reason for the one star was the complete lack of customer or technical support. Everytime I emailed or called I never got a response. And unfortunately I can't return the item so now it's a $170 paperweight.
customer_reviews.author: A. Finch

customer_reviews.title: Didn't Last A Year
customer_reviews.text: Worked fine in the beginning but then the sound started to come in and out on playback....Then the picture started to freeze sporadically. I hope they improve their product.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Nickels

customer_reviews.title: This unit works great. Using it with my Dish satellite system and ...
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been through a few DVRs using several different USB based drives. This unit works great. Using it with my Dish satellite system and the Samsung SSD:  And the HDMI splitter:  No audio sync problems, no video problems. Note that I have been a videophile since the ‘80s. I am finally happy with a device that captures HD video that is not proprietary to a cable or satellite system. This review is based on two weeks of use and 50 hours of recording. I will provide updates in a few weeks. Update 4/21/2018: Unit still works perfectly. Scheduling function has never failed. Have recorded around 100 hours of programs. I don’t find the difficulties others have with the menu system.
customer_reviews.author: Chris H Kost

customer_reviews.title: Good Recorder but...
customer_reviews.text: Dont buy the one with the Blaster. I spent more money to get that feature only to find out my direct tv box does not have an input for the blaster. I was told I had to purchase a "set box" for it to work. There is another Avermedia product without the blaster and it's cheaper. But the good news is that it does record from the firestick as long as you have a splitter than removes HDCP.
customer_reviews.author: CRW

customer_reviews.title: Awesome long-length HD recorder!
customer_reviews.text: I love this recorder! Makes beautiful long length, high-def recordings and doesn't add glitches every 15 minutes like other recorders. Records for several hours or more. Supports simple editing such as removing junk at the beginning or end of recorded videos. Also takes high-def screen shots. Records copy-protected sources using RGB inputs or an HDMI splitter. User interface isn't great, but gets the job done.
customer_reviews.author: Ronald Kossik

customer_reviews.title: Recording is good. USB memory is also possible
customer_reviews.text: Recording is good. USB memory is also possible. 64 giga memory is recorded for 9 hours. The hdcp terminal is not recordable. However, recording is possible using a converter.
customer_reviews.author: Gregorio

customer_reviews.title: works ok  could use some improvements !
customer_reviews.text: Just bought this DVR, setup was easy, upgrading firmware went ok, operation is a little slow doing some actions, takes more time than I would like to power up and actually start recording, a faster processor would have helped a lot. having a second USB port with support for a mouse and keypad would make a big difference in editing the videos. worth the lower price I paid, not really worth the msrp though.
customer_reviews.author: weston777

customer_reviews.title: Quality of recorded material is excellent
customer_reviews.text: My only gripe is the recorder is very slow to initialize from power off. Once the unit and the attached media are ready to go, the rest functions very well. Previously I captured video using a Hauppauge Colossus card but this unit is far more convenient as no PC is required. The small size makes it very portable. I've found that with the proper adapter, old VHS tapes can be copied and recorded. The MP4 files it creates can easily be edited external to the unit and burned to DVD. I use Nero with no issues.
customer_reviews.author: Gadgetman

customer_reviews.title: Great video capture for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Device works great. Record quality at 1080p is awesome. Needs fast (USB 3.0) powered external drive or USB stick to record. Had to experiment a little to get the right media. See other comments for help capturing things like PS4 game streams.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Robinson

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work and zero support.
customer_reviews.text: Cannot make it recognize my WD external hard drive. Product came with no user manual and online videos are worthless. Tried "contact us". Got to submit question. Got automatic response about how important it was. Got nothing else. Also, I have no idea how the IR blaster is supposed to work and no idea whether or not an internal hard drive is required. Worst support I've ever encountered. If I don't get help in a couple of days, I am returning the product.
customer_reviews.author: tom-r

customer_reviews.title: Customer Support Does No Exist and No Numbers to Call
customer_reviews.text: I was happy to receive this gadget; however, when I tried to sign up for warranty using the serial number as instructed, it didn’t work. Sent e-mail to seek assistance, no replies, and there are no numbers to call. I am thinking seriously about returning the product because it is not cheap and if it breaks, I would be SOL.
customer_reviews.author: JE of HNL

customer_reviews.title: Useless
customer_reviews.text: I decided to get rid of my FIOS TV and get one of those indoor antenna thingys. I bought this thing to record, BUT I didn't read the fine print. The antenna thingy naturally has an antenna plug, but this thing only accepts HDMI. I tried buying some sort of converter, but no dice. I'm sure many have been burned by this same problem. A waste of money!
customer_reviews.author: Rachel Cauley

customer_reviews.title: Thinks everything is copy righted
customer_reviews.text: It did not work, it said everything I hooked up to it is copy righted and while I realize my Roku is copyrighted the other media I hooked up is not copy righted. I emailed the company and no response, I have the latest firmware so that is not the issue. I am returning it to Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: No more DVR fees!!!
customer_reviews.text: Easy setup right out-of-the box, less 10 min. Using 32gb scan disk for video capture, with the option of expanding a larger external HDD. After initial set-up, not sure if I can use the program guide from the source to schedule in-the-future recordings. I'm ok with the pass thru capabilities when powered down, looking into more info in regarding to recordings from the source guide. If that is a NG, only a small inconvenience. 5 🌟

customer_reviews.title: EzRecorder 130 captures what you schedule
customer_reviews.text: I like to be able to record programs that are available when I am not. With a little practice and some additional equipment nearly anything can be captured. The only limitation is that only one setting can be captured unless it is captured daily.
customer_reviews.author: Barry R James

customer_reviews.title: The product working great, but I want to copy my own DVD ...

customer_reviews.title: But when it works it works GREAT! I can't wait to add a hard disk ...
customer_reviews.text: Slow to start up. Has problems with usb3 memories. cuts off the last 30 seconds of a 1 hour recording making hard to record back to back shows. On a Cisco cable box it will not programs channels over 100. When the cable fails on one show it will not record the next. But when it works it works GREAT! I can't wait to add a hard disk and see of some of the above problems go away.
customer_reviews.author: Brenda  J.  Dias

customer_reviews.title: No Quality Control
customer_reviews.text: Everything worked fine until I tried to navigate with the remote and there was no response from the remote. I changed the batteries with new fresh ones and still no response with any key on the remote. Lack of quality control from this manufacturer. I never got to try the actual unit.
customer_reviews.author: Spikeclaw LLC

customer_reviews.title: Well worth it
customer_reviews.text: If I could give this 10 stars, I would. UPDATE Using this with HDMI splitter that strips HDCP and Apple TV 4 (non-4K). Beautiful video recordings.
customer_reviews.author: David G Henderson

customer_reviews.title: Great Device But NEEDS a LARGE Storage Device
customer_reviews.text: This a GREAT product but the one I received did NOT work well with the 32GB thumb drive that was included with it. Avermedia would be wise to include something that warns customers about this. I subsequently purchased a 1TB portable drive and have had NO ISSUES since then. The menu interfaces are not very intuitive but workable. The MP4 files are of very good quality (even at the lowest setting) but are quite large. This can easily be remedied by running them through Handbrake or something similar and reduce their size quite a bit.
customer_reviews.author: J. Harper

customer_reviews.title: Doess not work with HDMI splitters to record HD TV
customer_reviews.text: If you are buying this in order to record HD TV, save your money. I tried three different splitters and spent at least 8 hours trying various combinations of connections and powering up sequences and was never able to avoid the anti-copying messages. Since TV recording was the only thing I bought this for all I have is a $125 paper weight.
customer_reviews.author: Spencer

customer_reviews.title: Save those home movies
customer_reviews.text: Great device to move those old home movies over to a network storage device
customer_reviews.author: jim

customer_reviews.title: Automatically stops recording after 14 hours even if your Memory drive can hold more.
customer_reviews.text: ONLY RECORDS FOR 14 HOURS. I wish I had known that it automatically stops after 14 hours of recording no matter how much MB you have plugged in or available. It comes with 32MB which is only about 4 hours. I attached a 128MB and it will not record past 14 hours in one session though my drive can hold much much more.
customer_reviews.author: JamesL

customer_reviews.title: Simple to set up and use. The ability to use thumb drives is very convenient.
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to set up and use. Make sure to get an HDMI splitter for best results. Recording quality is pretty sharp. Works fine with a Usb3 thumb drive.
customer_reviews.author: Clifd

customer_reviews.title: EZ ?  Not Yet
customer_reviews.text: Scratching my head what to do with this. My intent to capture video for playback like a DVR is thwarted by limited connectivity. HDMI IN and HDMI Out. Seeking help from company. Will update.

customer_reviews.title: User interface is very poor.
customer_reviews.text: Wanted to use it for time shifting TV programs. It is poorly engineered and designed. Cannot watch a program that has been recorded at the same time you are recording another. The file system is totally useless. Have a old DVR with a hard drive that is far superior to this product in every way. DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY ON THIS PRODUCT!!!

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality, worked only for two weeks.
customer_reviews.text: Recorded fine, with great video quality, for about two weeks. Then totally failed. Refused to acknowledge any input. Problem clearly with the product, not the connections.
customer_reviews.author: Blue&Gold

customer_reviews.title: Note Uses NTFS but this works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Great product with the benefit of recording. Note that it has to have NT File system drives to work. I might have selected something else if I had known that up front, but the unit works well. I use a travel HD and it works well, but it's kinda overkill for what I need. I had hoped to use a USB Stick. Rejects HDCP content.
customer_reviews.author: Glenn Hargett

customer_reviews.title: I'm impressed.
customer_reviews.text: This really is a pretty good DVR. It's more complex than you might think which makes it very versatile. Although the instructions say that a USB HD is required, I find that a USB stick (flash drive) works well. Right now I'm using a 128 GB USB 3 which gives me about 30 hours of recording time. (Available here for less than $30) I use a cheap 720p HDMI TV to monitor what I'm recording. The MP4 video files are easily edited in Kdenlive and then moved to a NAS server for Kodi to pick up and then available on the big screen.
customer_reviews.author: radiotales

customer_reviews.title: disappointing, worked once
customer_reviews.text: never worked properly. The one time it did work, the video wasn't useful to playback or transfer to another device. A real waste of money. It's been sitting in a drawer ever since a few weeks after I bought it.
customer_reviews.author: M. A. Davis

customer_reviews.title: WILL NOT RECORD YOUTUBE OR ROKU OR NETFLICS.

YOU COULD HAVE SAVED ME A LOT OF TIME AND EFFORT TO SIMPLY PLACE THIS IN YOUR DESCRIPTION AS YOU CLAIM ALL OF THAT IS SOMEHOW PROTECTED AND YOUR SYSTEM REFUSES TO RECORD IT. WASTE OF TIME.

customer_reviews.title: Worked fine until it stopped playing audio weather video footage
customer_reviews.text: It worked fine for 2 months and it's been making no sound ever since I tried every way of hooking it up and tried every possible way of figure out what was wrong but it just stopped playing back sound I have video footage on there that I recorded that has sound but now it doesn't play back so it's relatively useless no point in having video with no sound.
customer_reviews.author: James Reed "Dharman"

customer_reviews.title: Bought a refurb and it works okay, see the review
customer_reviews.text: Purchased the refurbished model. The only issue was the flash drive that came with it, I put in another higher speed flash drive and it does exactly what it's supposed to do.
customer_reviews.author: Dave In Montana

customer_reviews.title: Setup will take time and intuition not everything is explained or obvious.
customer_reviews.text: Remote control should be bigger and explanation of menu items could be better. Picture quality is excellent, IR blaster worked as promised, but should be set up for more than three digit channel out of the box shouldn't have to do extra steps to get more than three digits for cable channels. Hard drive capacity should be greater than 2TB, 4TB would be nice. Formatting and recognizing the internal hard drive took a little longer than expected. Otherwise happy with purchase.

customer_reviews.title: Purple hue in tje recorded video.

customer_reviews.title: with the proper splitter you can record anything

customer_reviews.title: What definitely buy another

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: This does exactly what it was supposed to do. You can record to an external USB drive anything that outputs HDMI. The product description says you can use a hard drive, but you can only use one that gets power from a power outlet as this cannot power a hard drive on its own. I used a 128 GB 3.0 USB flash drive with no issues. Other similar devices I tried had issues recording such as the audio and video being out of sync. But I have had none of those issues with this one. I would definitely recommend this for someone who wants to be able to record video without the use of a computer.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent HDMI recorder - superb recordings
customer_reviews.text: I have to say, I was not expecting much of this unit, but I was pleasantly surprised as it comes loaded with features that actually work. You can edit the beginning and end of recorded videos very easily within the unit, which comes in handy for those programmed recordings which don't start or end at exactly the time you set it for. Using an NTFS drive, you can record lengthy videos greater than 2GB in size. You can set the recording quality, which will of course, affect the size of the video file. Speaking of which, the video quality is superb - super sharp with excellent colors. I have no complaints about the unit as it works beautifully.

customer_reviews.title: Half-Baked Product - Won't recognize standard hard drives or USB sticks
customer_reviews.text: I had good luck with the AVerMedia Live Gamer Portable, so I thought I'd upgrade to this - BIG MISTAKE. This device simply won't work with any drives I have. I tried 8G & 64G USB sticks, a 1TB hard drive, and a 2TB SSD. All were brand new drives and freshly formatted with the required NTFS partition. The EzRecorder finally recognized one of the USB drives but refused to install the latest firmware from the drive. This has the potential to be a very nice product, but for now it's so half-baked that it's totally useless. I'm returning it as defective.
